0.title: Maharashtra police beat up man for keeping shop open late at night
0.article_body: A man was allegedly beaten up by police officers in Maharashtra's Aurangabad for keeping his shop open late at night. A video of the incident has surfaced online. A police officer said that the man had refused and used abusive language when the officers asked him to shut his shop on noticing that it was open past 12.30 am.

1.title: Actress Blake Lively's Met Gala dress transforms from copper into aqua blue, pics viral
1.article_body: Actress Blake Lively wore a transforming dress at the Met Gala 2022, whose theme was 'In America: An Anthology of Fashion'. Lively wore a red-toned gown featuring a large bow. The actress' bow was untied after a while, unveiling a long blue train. "I arrived copper and then like New York City classic architecture, I patinaed," she said.

2.title: 4 students injured as plaster falls from school lobby roof in Gujarat
2.article_body: Four students of a government primary school in Gujarat's Mahisagar district were injured on Monday after cement plaster from the roof of lobby fell on them. The incident occurred during the farewell function of a retiring teacher. Along with students, their parents, villagers and school management committee members were also present, said District Primary Education Officer (DPEO) PN Modi.

3.title: Child trafficking racket busted in Lucknow, 2-year-old boy rescued
3.article_body: A child trafficking gang was busted by the Government Railway Police (GRP), Charbagh in Lucknow after a two-year-old baby was rescued from the possession of three alleged kidnappers. The three accused were arrested while a minor was detained. "The complainant is homeless and lives on the platform along with his three children, including the two-year-old baby," a police official said.

4.title: Ebola outbreak in DR Congo prompts high alert in Tanzania
4.article_body: Tanzania has been put on high alert following an Ebola outbreak in neighbouring Democratic Republic of the Congo (DRC), which has reportedly caused the death of two persons. The Tanzanian government said it has sent teams of surveillance experts to areas bordering DRC. "People should take precautionary measures as the government is working on the issue," said a government official.

5.title: Mom's skin turned dark; she saw herself, broke down: Daughter on Nargis' cancer
5.article_body: Late actress Nargis' daughter Namrata Dutt said that her mother "broke down" after she saw her reflection in mirror after her chemotherapy treatment after being diagnosed with pancreatic cancer. "Her skin had turned dark with chemotherapy. She had lost hair. She couldn't believe what she saw," Dutt said. She added that they talked to Nargis when she was in coma.

6.title: 40% of global real-time digital payments took place in India in 2021: PM
6.article_body: PM Narendra Modi while addressing the Indian community in Germany's Berlin said of all the global real-time digital payments in 2021, 40% took place in India. "Almost 10,000 services of Central government, state government and local self-government have become available online," he added. "The way technology is being included in governance shows...new political will of the new India," PM stated.

7.title: For my son, Nadal is no longer no.1; Alcaraz is his favourite: Djokovic
7.article_body: World number one Novak Djokovic said Spain's Carlos Alcaraz has replaced Rafael Nadal as his son Stefan's favourite player over the last month. "Alcaraz is a big star already. He's got the whole package. I really like him. I have so much respect for him," added Djokovic. "I have had some amazing battles with Nadal. It's always special," stated Djokovic.

8.title: PM Modi extends greetings on Eid-ul-Fitr, calls for brotherhood
8.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi took to Twitter on Monday to extend greetings on the occasion of Eid-ul-Fitr. "Best wishes on Eid-ul-Fitr. May this auspicious occasion enhance the spirit of togetherness and brotherhood in our society," he tweeted. "May everyone be blessed with good health and prosperity," PM Modi added.

9.title: I was hiding inside my house for 2 weeks: Osaka on her media boycott
9.article_body: Discussing her decision to boycott post-match media duties in 2021, ex-world number one Naomi Osaka said, "I was really sad. I was...embarrassed. I was kind of hiding inside my house for like two weeks." "I didn't really know how to cope with it," added Osaka. "Even though I was...scared, I was happy with the choice that I made," stated Osaka.

10.title: BSNL, MTNL likely to switch to 4G by end of 2022: Devusinh Chauhan
10.article_body: The Bharat Sanchar Nigam Limited (BSNL) and Mahanagar Telephone Nigam Limited (MTNL) are likely to switch to 4G network by the end of 2022, MoS for Communications, Devusinh Chauhan, said. Chauhan added that the 5G spectrum will be rolled out by December-end across India. "We are setting up the infrastructure for 5G spectrum, which will soon see auctions," Chauhan stated.

11.title: It split me open: Gwyneth Paltrow on losing her father at 30
11.article_body: Gwyneth Paltrow has revealed that she lost her father, Bruce Paltrow, to throat cancer when she was 30 years old. "When it first happened I never anticipated that it was possible to have a feeling like that. It was not in my lexicon of emotions," she added. "It was so physical it felt like it split me open," Gwyneth said.

12.title: HC stays lower court observations against Assam Police in Mevani case
12.article_body: The Gauhati High Court stayed the observations, which were critical of Assam Police, made by a lower court while granting bail to Gujarat MLA Jignesh Mevani. Sessions Judge Aparesh Chakravarty had observed that the case against Mevani, filed for allegedly outraging the modesty of a woman police officer, was "manufactured" by police only to extend his custody.

13.title: AAP members arrested after clash with BJP workers in Gujarat
13.article_body: A clash broke out between workers of Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) and BJP in Gujarat's Surat on Monday. Several AAP members, including its state unit chief Gopal Italia, were arrested on charges of rioting. The incident occurred when AAP workers marched to the BJP headquarters to protest against the alleged assault on their councillors at Surat Municipal Corporation.

14.title: Haryana BJP MLA takes oath to make India 'Hindu Rashtra', video surfaces
14.article_body: Bharatiya Janata Party MLA Aseem Goel on Sunday took an oath to make India a 'Hindu Rashtra'. A video of incident was shared online. The pledge that was administered by Sudarshan News' Suresh Chavhanke, said, "We pledge to make Hindustan Hindu Rashtra...If needed...we will make or take sacrifice for it but at any cost...we will declare Hindustan as Hindu Rashtra."

15.title: India records 2,568 COVID-19 cases, 20 deaths in the last 24 hours
15.article_body: India has reported 2,568 COVID-19 cases, 2,911 recoveries and 20 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country saw 3,157 COVID-19 cases and 26 deaths. Active cases in India stand at 19,137, while the death toll has risen to 5,23,889.

16.title: Samson takes review in frustration to protest umpire's wide ball call, video goes viral
16.article_body: RR captain Sanju Samson took a review in frustration to protest umpire calling a wide in second-last over of KKR's run chase. KKR's Rinku Singh had shuffled across and failed to make contact with ball, with the umpire signalling it wide. Sanju opted for a review for caught behind. The replays confirmed the ball being far away from the bat.

17.title: We thought it was the last day of our life, I'll never fly again: SpiceJet flyer
17.article_body: A 22-year-old passenger named Imamul Ansari onboard Mumbai-Durgapur SpiceJet aircraft that encountered severe turbulence said, "We thought it was going to be the last day of our life. I'll never board a flight again." He added, "This was my first flight experience, and it landed me in hospital." He suffered a fracture in right-hand finger and injuries in his back.

18.title: BJP leader urges Delhi CM to remove loudspeakers from religious places
18.article_body: BJP leader Adesh Gupta on Monday wrote to Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal urging him to immediately remove loudspeakers from religious and other places as per the Supreme Court’s guidelines. "Wrote a letter to CM Arvind Kejriwal…Due to noise pollution, children, elderly people, patients and people working in offices have to face difficulties every day," Gupta tweeted.

19.title: Map out road routes to speed up coal transport: CM Yogi tells officials
19.article_body: Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath on Monday directed officials to map out road routes to speed up coal transport to thermal power plants in the state amid the ongoing power crisis. Calling for a wide-scale reform in the power sector, he asked the officials to bring major changes at all levels and meet the increasing electricity demand.

20.title: Kim wears Marilyn Monroe's dress at Met Gala, says 'Lost 7 kg in 3 weeks to fit into it'
20.article_body: American media personality Kim Kardashian wore the custom-made Jean Louis Gown that was worn by Marilyn Monroe during her performance for ex-US President John F Kennedy in 1962. Kim revealed she lost 7 kg in three weeks to fit into the dress, which holds the Guinness World Record for 'most expensive dress sold at auction' at $4.8 million.

21.title: Tuition teacher told mom 'Your son is only interested in my clothes': Manish
21.article_body: Fashion designer Manish Malhotra in a conversation with Twinkle Khanna revealed that his mother hired a tuition teacher for him when he was five or six years old. "[Mom] knew I was a duffer student," he said, adding, "Tuition teacher told her 'Your son is only interested in my clothes...He never studies and...keeps telling me...my sandals aren't matching my dress'."

22.title: When I came, everybody was against it: Ibrahimović on Man Utd stint
22.article_body: Discussing his experience while representing Manchester United, ex-Barcelona striker Zlatan Ibrahimović said, "When I came, everybody was against it...and...in England they didn't like me." "I like people when they hate you [as]...they bring out the better of you," added Ibrahimović. "All [the] haters after three months, they started [liking]...me. I didn't like them anymore," stated Ibrahimović.

23.title: School bus collides with tractor in Gurugram, bus driver dies
23.article_body: A 40-year-old school bus driver died and over 15 students escaped unhurt after their speeding school bus rammed a stationary tractor on Gurugram's Sohna Road. The bus driver was ferrying students to GD Goenka World School when the incident took place at around 8.15 am. "The younger students were traumatised and wanted to return home," the police said.

24.title: Muslims being targeted with violence around the world: Biden
24.article_body:
Addressing a White House reception to celebrate Eid-ul-Fitr, US President Joe Biden said 
Muslims are being targeted with violence all over the world. "No one should discriminate against oppressed or be oppressed for their religious beliefs," Biden added. He also said that Muslims make America stronger every day "even as they still face real challenges and threats in our society".

25.title: Prabhudeva to choreograph Chiranjeevi & Salman Khan's song in Godfather
25.article_body: Choreographer Prabhudeva will choreograph actors Chiranjeevi and Salman Khan for a special song in 'Godfather'. Music composer of 'Godfather', S Thaman, took to Twitter to share a picture with Chiranjeevi, director Mohan Raja along with Prabhudeva to welcome him on board. He wrote, "Prabhudeva will be choreographing an atom bombing swinging song for our boss Chiranjeevi and Salman...What a high."

26.title: He needed to make a statement, he did it: McCullum on Rinku's 42*(23) vs RR
26.article_body: KKR head coach Brendon McCullum has praised Rinku Singh after their win against RR, stating that the 24-year-old needed to make a statement and he did it with his unbeaten 42-run innings in the match. "Rinku has been in the franchise for a long period of time. Lucky enough to spend some time with him," added McCullum.

27.title: 3-level security system launched at Durgam Cheruvu in Hyderabad
27.article_body: The Cyberabad Police on Monday launched a three-level security system, including surveillance cameras, electric bike patrolling unit and lake patrolling boat, at Durgam Cheruvu in Hyderabad. This comes amid reports of bike races, a suicide and other disturbing activities near Durgam Cheruvu and its surroundings. The new surveillance system has been established in public-private partnership mode.

28.title: Stone pelting in Jodhpur, internet services suspended; CM appeals to maintain peace
28.article_body: Internet services have been suspended in Rajasthan's Jodhpur after a stone-pelting incident and clashes between two communities at Jalori Gate. "All 2G/3G/4G/ Data, bulk SMS/MMS/Whatsapp, Facebook, Twitter...except voice calls, broadband internet, leased lines...suspended till further orders," the order reads. CM Ashok Gehlot appealed to maintain peace and cooperate in maintaining law and order.

29.title: 43-yr-old man dies after speeding autorickshaw hits two-wheeler in Pune
29.article_body: A 43-year-old man died after a two-wheeler that he was driving was hit by a speeding autorickshaw in the Pimpri area of Pimpri-Chinchwad in Pune, police said. The accident took place when the rickshaw driver, coming from the opposite direction, allegedly hit the man, which caused him to fall from his vehicle. The victim had received head injuries, police added.

30.title: French to be introduced in 30 Delhi govt schools
30.article_body: The Delhi Board of Senior Secondary Education (DBSSE) tied up with Institut Français en Inde (IFI) to introduce French in city's government schools. In the pilot phase, French will be introduced in 30 schools and is supposed to expand further to other schools. Introduction of French will unlock new career options for our students, Deputy CM Manish Sisodia said.

31.title: I miss the glamorous life sometimes: Evelyn on a new life in Australia
31.article_body: Actress Evelyn Sharma, who's settled in Australia with her husband and daughter, said she misses Bollywood sometimes. "Glamorous life, I do miss it sometimes. Red carpet and getting dressed up. Beautiful gowns and sarees...But it's all come together so well," she added. "I don't even need to think of what could've been, because it (her present life) is...perfect," Evelyn said.

32.title: Structure collapses on workers in Pune; 1 dead, 4 seriously injured
32.article_body: A 40-year-old worker was killed and four others were seriously injured after a slab structure collapsed on them at an under-construction building site in Pune on Monday. "After the collapse of the slab structure...workers were trapped under the metal and wooden bars," a senior inspector said. A total of 25 workers were on site when the incident took place.

33.title: Ayurvedic doctor, wife perform illegal abortion in Panchkula, booked
33.article_body: An Ayurvedic doctor, Anil Kaushal and his wife have been booked for allegedly carrying out an illegal abortion in Panchkula's Rajiv Colony. The matter came to light when the patient suffered multiple organ failure after being diagnosed with post-abortion infection at government hospital. When asked, her husband revealed she underwent an abortion at a clinic on April 26 and 27.

34.title: 2 yrs after body was found, 2nd wife, lover held for killing Pune man
34.article_body: Nearly two years after his body was found, a man's second wife, Pallavi, and her lover, Ganesh, were arrested for killing him. Ganesh and Pallavi made plan for latter to befriend Ganesh's uncle, Savkar Ghule, and marry him for property. Pallavi convinced Ghule to sell off his property. Later, Pallavi and Ganesh fed Ghule poison and dumped body on roadside.

35.title: Wickets at the wrong time stopped me from going on with momentum: Samson
35.article_body: RR captain Sanju Samson, who top-scored for his team with 54(49) against KKR, said he stopped himself from going on with the momentum as they kept losing wickets at "the wrong time". "Wanted to build up a partnership and when I wanted to go hard...they bowled really well," he added. KKR defeated RR by seven wickets in the match.

36.title: UK to provide $375 mn of further military aid to Ukraine
36.article_body: The UK has said it'd provide an additional £300 million ($375 million) in military aid to Ukraine. The new package includes electronic warfare equipment, a counter-battery radar system, GPS jamming equipment and night vision devices. Britain has sent Ukraine over 5,000 anti-tank missiles, five air defence systems and other munitions and explosives since the Russian invasion began on February 24.

37.title: Cocaine worth ₹80 cr found hidden in trolley bags at Hyd airport
37.article_body: The Directorate of Revenue Intelligence (DRI) officers have seized a total of 8 kg of cocaine worth ₹80 crore from two foreign nationals at the Hyderabad International Airport, in separate incidents. The accused carried 4 kg of cocaine each, which was hidden in the false bottoms of their trolley bags. The two accused were apprehended by the DRI officers.

38.title: Mango Mela to be held in Bengaluru after gap of 2 years
38.article_body: The annual Mango Mela will return to Bengaluru this year after a gap of two years owing to COVID-19 pandemic. According to a government official, the mela or festival will be organised in Lalbagh and Cubbon Park around the first or second week of June. "We will also have district-level melas after the second week of May," said the official.

39.title: Now no PM will have to say he sends ₹1, but only 15 paise reaches people: PM Modi
39.article_body: Addressing the Indian community in Berlin, Prime Minister Narendra Modi talked about the success of digital payment mechanism in India. He said that the government is using the mechanism to make payments to farmers directly. PM Modi said that now no Prime Minister will have to lament that he sends one rupee, but only 15 paise reaches the beneficiary.

40.title: Spurious seeds racket busted in Hyderabad, 2 arrested
40.article_body: The Rachakonda Police on Monday busted an inter-state spurious seeds racket in Hyderabad and arrested two persons. Police also seized 15 quintals of spurious cotton BT3 seeds, a car and two mobile phones, all worth ₹30 lakh. According to police, the accused allegedly procured the seeds from Karnataka and sold them to unsuspecting farmers in Telangana, Maharashtra and Odisha.

41.title: 66-yr-old ex-India cricketer Arun Lal marries 28 years younger Bulbul Saha, pics surface
41.article_body: Former India cricketer Arun Lal tied the knot with 38-year-old Bulbul Saha in Kolkata on Monday. It is the 66-year-old Bengal cricket team head coach's second marriage. The wedding was attended by former India wicketkeeper Saba Karim and MP Derek O'Brien. Bulbul Saha is a teacher by profession.

42.title: List of Indian cities with highest maximum temperature on Monday released
42.article_body: The India Meteorological Department (IMD) released a list of cities recording the highest maximum temperature on Monday. Rajasthan's Ganganagar and Churu recorded the highest maximum temperature at 45.3°C each. Maharashtra's Chandrapur recorded 45.2°C. Maximum temperature of more than 45°C was recorded at three stations on Monday as compared to over 30 stations on April 29.

43.title: Natasha Poonawalla wears metal bustier with Sabyasachi saree at Met Gala, look goes viral
43.article_body: Serum Institute of India's executive director Natasha Poonawalla wore a Schiaparelli hand-forged metal bustier paired with a custom Sabyasachi couture saree and trail at the Met Gala 2022. According to Sabyasachi, Natasha Poonawalla's vision for the event was to interpret the dress code 'gilded glamour' with an Indian gaze that revels in its multi-culturalism and authenticity.

44.title: Wife's friends felt we won't last, said 'film people are over friendly': Shaan
44.article_body: Singer Shaan said before his marriage, his wife Radhika's friends used to say film people are over friendly. "[They said] today they are here, tomorrow they are there," Shaan said, adding, "I was her first boyfriend...six years older to her...so they didn't think that we would last...I also didn't have such hopes because we were very different from each other."

45.title: Amit Shah to inaugurate Nrupathunga University in Bengaluru today
45.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah is scheduled to inaugurate the Nrupathunga University, formerly called Government Science College, in Bengaluru on Tuesday. The college, which was established by the erstwhile Maharaja of Mysore Nalvadi Krishnaraja Wadiyar, had attained university status in 2020. The university offers undergraduate and postgraduate courses, as well as research programmes for students.

46.title: 45-yr-old driver killed after school bus rams into tractor in Gurugram
46.article_body: A 45-year-old bus driver was killed as the school bus that he was driving rammed into a tractor-trolley on Gurugram's Sohna Road. As many as 15 school students and school staff were also on the bus and they were unhurt, police said. "It is not clear if the tractor suddenly stopped or it had been parked," police added.

47.title: Mumbai man uses fake number plates to escape ₹24,300 e-challan dues
47.article_body: Mumbai Police have arrested a man for using fake number plates on his bike in a bid to avoid payment of e-challan dues worth ₹24,300. An FIR was filed against the man on April 30, for cheating the government, following which, he was arrested. During investigation, police found that two number plates had been registered under the man's name.

48.title: KKR end their 5-match losing streak, hand RR their 2nd straight defeat
48.article_body: KKR defeated RR by seven wickets on Monday to end their five-match losing streak and move to the seventh position on the IPL 2022 points table. Rinku Singh and Nitish Rana's unbeaten 66-run partnership helped KKR chase down the 153-run target in 19.1 overs. RR have now lost two matches in a row.

49.title: When the world faces a problem, India brings solutions: PM Modi in Berlin
49.article_body: PM Modi while addressing the Indian diaspora in Germany's Berlin said, "The biggest truth of this third decade of the 21st century is that India is going global." He added, "During COVID-19, India helped save many lives by sending essential medicines to more than 150 countries." When the world faces a problem, India brings solutions, he said.

50.title: New India takes risks, it innovates: PM to Indian community in Germany
50.article_body: PM Narendra Modi while addressing Indian community in Berlin said new India doesn't think of a secure future alone. "It takes risks, it innovates, it incubates," he added. He said, "I remember that around 2014, our country had only 200-400 startups. Today, the country has more than 68,000 startups," PM Modi further said.

51.title: US can't confirm top Russian General injured in Ukraine: Official
51.article_body: The US cannot confirm media reports that the head of the Russian armed forces, General Valery Gerasimov, was injured during a visit to Ukraine's Donbas region, a US official said on Monday. Several media reports have claimed that Gerasimov was wounded during fighting. Notably, Russian forces launched a fresh offensive in Ukraine last month after retreating from the country's north.

52.title: Should we retire then, jokes Shaheen as wicketkeeper Rizwan bowls in county match
52.article_body: Reacting to Pakistan wicketkeeper-batter Muhammad Rizwan bowling in a county match, Pakistan fast bowler Shaheen Afridi jokingly tweeted, "Rizzi bhai, should we retire then?" Shaheen added, "What are you doing? Leave something for us." Rizwan, who represents Sussex in county cricket, bowled two overs against Durham, conceding five runs.

53.title: People of India made government stronger in 2019: PM Modi in Berlin
53.article_body: PM Narendra Modi while addressing Indian community in Berlin said a full majority government was elected in India in 2014 after 30 years and the people of the country made the government stronger in 2019. "The people of India ended the politically unstable atmosphere of the last three decades by pressing a button," PM Modi added.

54.title: Google makes $100,000-online courses free to every US business
54.article_body: Google announced on Monday that it will provide any US business over $100,000 worth of online courses in data analytics, design and other tech skills for their workers free of charge. The offer marks an expansion of Google's Career Certificates, which was launched in 2018. As per Google, 205,000 people globally have earned at least one certificate through the program.

55.title: Delhivery IPO likely to open on May 11, firm to raise ₹5,235 cr: Report
55.article_body: The initial public offering (IPO) of logistics startup Delhivery is likely to open for subscription on May 11 and close on May 13, Moneycontrol reported citing senior bankers. The Gurugram-based startup now plans to raise ₹5,235 crore through the IPO, down from the ₹7,460 crore planned earlier, Moneycontrol added. The offer will reportedly comprise a fresh issue of ₹4,000 crore.

56.title: Liverpool midfielder Thiago would start for each team in the world: Klopp
56.article_body: Praising Liverpool midfielder Thiago Alcantara, manager Jürgen Klopp said due to his current form he would play in "each team in the world" and for his country Spain as well. Thiago was 'Man of the Match' in Liverpool's 2-0 win over Villarreal in first leg of their semi-final in Champions League. The 31-year-old was bought by Liverpool in September 2020.

57.title: Rare tree kangaroo born in US zoo after 14 years, video released
57.article_body: A zoo in the US has announced the birth of a tree kangaroo for the first time since 2008. The Matschie's tree kangaroo is native to Papua New Guinea and there are fewer than 2,500 of the species remaining in the wild. A video of the newborn has shown it poking its nose out of its mother's pouch.

58.title: Not everyone in KKR dressing room is on the same page: Dasgupta
58.article_body: Speaking about KKR's performance following their five straight losses in IPL 2022 so far, Deep Dasgupta said not everyone in the franchise's dressing room is on the "same page". He added that after KKR won three out of four matches at the start, they should've held to that combination but they made too many changes in the last few matches.

59.title: New Zealand welcomes tourists after 2-year pause due to pandemic
59.article_body: New Zealand on Monday welcomed tourists from across the world for the first time in over two years after dropping most of its remaining pandemic border restrictions. Notably, the borders were opened to tourists from only about 60 countries, including much of Europe. Before the COVID-19  pandemic, New Zealand would welcome around 30 lakh tourists annually.

60.title: CCPA calls meeting with Ola, Uber over several user complaints
60.article_body: The Central Consumer Protection Authority (CCPA) has called a meeting of ride-hailing platforms like Ola and Uber following a "very high" number of complaints from customers. "The complaints [are] regarding the cancellation and pricing policy of cab aggregators," said CCPA Chief Commissioner Nidhi Khare. She added that it appears that cab aggregators are using algorithms to lure new customers.

61.title: Brian Lara only cricketer to score 500 runs in an innings
61.article_body: Ex-West Indies captain Brian Lara scored 501*(427) in a county match in 1994, becoming the first and the only player to score 500-plus runs in an innings in professional cricket. Lara hit 62 fours and 10 sixes during his innings, while representing Warwickshire against Durham. Lara, who turned 53 on Monday, also holds record for the highest Test score (400*).

62.title: People chant '2024, Modi Once More' as PM addresses Indian community in Berlin
62.article_body: A video has shown people chanting '2024, Modi Once More' ahead of Prime Minister Narendra Modi's address to the Indian community in Germany's Berlin on Monday. "Today...I want to talk...about the capabilities of crores of Indians," said PM Modi. He is on the first leg of his visit to three European nations and met German Chancellor Olaf Scholz today.

63.title: 5 of family die as shipping container falls off truck and crushes their car in Gujarat
63.article_body: Five members of a family died as their car met with an accident on the outskirts of Gujarat's Navsari, officials said. The victims were returning home from Surat after completing shopping for marriage when their car got crushed under a shipping container. The shipping container fell off a truck and crushed their car, PTI reported.

64.title: Anil Kapoor watches 'RRR' with Anupam Kher, says 'Feels like a date'
64.article_body: Actor Anupam Kher shared a video with Anil Kapoor while they had gone to watch Ram Charan and Jr NTR-starrer 'RRR' in the theatre. In the video, Anil could be heard saying, "I'm feeling as if I am in St Xavier's college...as if I've come out for a date." To this, Anupam responded, "I would not like to say that."

65.title: Sri Lankan govt's focus should be to get aid, not attain parl majority: Ex-PM
65.article_body: Ex-Sri Lankan PM Ranil Wickremesinghe has said that country's political leadership should focus on securing financial aid rather than worrying about attaining a parliamentary majority amid the economic crisis. "National economy has almost collapsed...Problems can't be solved by mustering 113 seats in parliament," he added. Sri Lankan coalition government lost majority after 42 MPs quit alliance.

66.title: RR skipper Samson needs to cut down on risky shots: Jaffer
66.article_body: Talking about Sanju Samson's form in IPL 2022, Wasim Jaffer said RR skipper needs to be calculative and cut down on risky shots since he's batting at number three. "Sometimes playing high-risk cricket can get you in trouble and he isn't someone who is batting at number five or six, where he needs to take that risk," he added.

67.title: When I grew up, Nadal became my great reference: World no. 1 Swiatek
67.article_body: World number one Iga Swiatek said growing up she looked up to her elder Agata for playing tennis before Rafael Nadal became her great reference. "I admire his work ethic and how success hasn't changed him, he's still a very nice...humble guy," she added. Having won four consecutive titles in 2022, Swiatek is on a 23-match unbeaten streak.

68.title: I think I am going to be a yes mom: Sonam Kapoor to Anushka Sharma
68.article_body: Actress Sonam Kapoor, who is expecting her first child with husband Anand Ahuja, responded to Anushka Sharma's Instagram Stories and said that she will be a "YES Mom" for her child. Earlier, Anushka, taking to her Instagram Stories, asked, "How many times in a day do parents end up saying NO...Are you a yes parent or no parent?"

69.title: Alia shares note she received from Big B for 'Gangubai...' performance
69.article_body: Actress Alia Bhatt shared several of her selfies on Instagram on Monday. Among them, she shared a picture with a note she received from Amitabh Bachchan for her performance in 'Gangubai Kathiawadi'. "Alia, you are beyond magnificent in 'Gangubai Kathiawadi'," the note from Amitabh read. The veteran actor added that he is "short of words" to praise her performance.

70.title: Over 3,000 civilians killed due to Russia's invasion of Ukraine: UN
70.article_body: The UN human rights office on Monday said that the death toll of civilians killed in Ukraine since the start of the Russian invasion rose to 3,153. Citing access difficulties and ongoing corroboration efforts, it claimed that the real toll is likely considerably higher. Most of the victims were killed by explosive weapons with a wide impact area, it added.

71.title: Rajiv Ranjan replaces Mridul Saggar as MPC ex-officio member
71.article_body: The Board of Reserve Bank of India (RBI) on Monday approved the nomination of Executive Director Rajiv Ranjan as an ex-officio member of the monetary policy committee (MPC). Ranjan will replace Mridul Saggar, who is reportedly to retire by end of April. As per his LinkedIn profile, Ranjan was recently the head of the Department of Economic and Policy Research.

72.title: Du Plessis would be a bit jealous, jokes Gaikwad after record partnership with Conway
72.article_body: After registering the highest-ever partnership for CSK with Devon Conway, Ruturaj Gaikwad joked that his former CSK opening partner Faf Du Plessis would be a bit jealous. "It feels really nice to have this record. We didn't expect it. All we wanted was to start off really well [against SRH]," he added. Gaikwad and Conway shared a 182-run opening stand.

73.title: Maha Minister Nawab Malik hospitalised, condition serious: Lawyer
73.article_body: Maharashtra Minister Nawab Malik, arrested by the Enforcement Directorate in a money laundering case, was admitted to a Mumbai hospital as he was suffering from diarrhoea, vomiting, and fever for the last three days, his lawyer informed a court. The lawyer said the minister's condition was serious. The hospital said the minister is under observation at the Intensive Care Unit.

74.title: Practo elevates top executive Siddhartha Nihalani as Co-founder
74.article_body: Bengaluru-based healthcare company Practo on Monday announced the elevation of its long-term executive and growth head Siddhartha Nihalani to the position of Co-founder. With this, Nihalani will accompany other Co-founders, Shashank ND and Abhinav Lal, who were his batchmates at NIT Karnataka. Last year, ahead of its IPO, Zomato had elevated its ex-CFO Akriti Chopra to the Co-founder position.

75.title: 65-yr-old man strangled by 3 sons in Punjab over property dispute
75.article_body: A 65-year-old man was allegedly strangled to death by his three sons over a property dispute in Punjab's Fazilka on Monday. The accused used to often fight with the victim, Chinder Pal, who had disowned the trio, the victim's brother Jaswinder Singh said. The victim's body has been sent for postmortem and the accused are yet to be arrested.

76.title: MP man marries 3 partners at same time as per tribal customs
76.article_body: A 42-year-old man married his three live-in partners at the same function in accordance with tribal customs in Madhya Pradesh's Alirajpur district. Maurya informed PTI that he had got engaged to his first partner in 2003 and his two other partners have also been living with him over the past 15 years. His six children also participated in the rituals.

77.title: Pak may quash ex-PM Nawaz Sharif's conviction in graft cases: Report
77.article_body: Pakistani government may quash or suspend ex-PM Nawaz Sharif's conviction in graft cases to offer him chance to plead afresh before a court, Dawn reported. Minister Rana Sanaullah Khan said federal and Punjab's provincial governments can suspend accused's punishment who's been 'wrongly' sentenced. Sharif, convicted in two corruption cases in 2018, left for London in 2019 for medical treatment.

78.title: Japan, Thailand sign defence deal during PM Kishida's visit
78.article_body: During a visit to Thailand, Japanese PM Fumio Kishida and his Thai counterpart Prayut Chan-o-cha signed a defence agreement on Monday. The agreement would facilitate the transfer of defence hardware and technology from Japan to Thailand, according to Reuters. The deal was signed as Kishida wrapped up the last leg of a three-nation tour of Southeast Asia.

79.title: Denmark to destroy 11 lakh soon-to-expire doses of COVID vaccines
79.article_body: Denmark will destroy 11 lakh doses of COVID-19 vaccines because their expiration date is near, a government agency said on Monday. Denmark has a surplus of vaccines and efforts to donate them to developing countries have failed, it added. The epidemic in Denmark "is currently under control, and the vaccine coverage in the Danish population is high", it further said.

80.title: SBI gives no-dues certificate to farmer withheld over 31 paise
80.article_body: SBI on Monday told the Gujarat High Court that it has issued a no-dues certificate to a farmer after the court said not issuing the certificate over pending dues of 31 paise is "nothing but harassment". SBI added that it couldn't issue it earlier in view of a letter sent by the farmer asking it not to do so.

81.title: Power Grid to buy IL&FS Energy Development Company's CPTCL stake
81.article_body: State-owned Power Grid Corporation of India will purchase IL&FS Energy Development Company Ltd's (IEDCL) equity shareholding in Cross Border Power Transmission Company Ltd (CPTCL), as per a regulatory filing. Currently, Power Grid owns 26% stake in CPTCL while 38% shareholding is with IEDCL. Meanwhile, Satluj Jal Vidyut Nigam (SJVN) owns 26% and Nepal Electricity Authority owns 10% stake.

82.title: Claims of normalcy in J&K self-serving lies, contradictions: Mufti
82.article_body: Former Jammu and Kashmir Chief Minister Mehbooba Mufti on Monday said that claims of normalcy in the Union Territory by the Centre are "self-serving lies and contradictions"."Eid prayers are disallowed yet again in Jama Masjid tomorrow. Stripping people not only of their fundamental rights but also religious freedom symbolises their ruthlessness," she tweeted.

83.title: LIC IPO anchor book oversubscribed; gets bids of over ₹7,000 cr
83.article_body: The anchor investor portion of LIC initial public offering (IPO) was oversubscribed on Monday, the first day of subscription. Reports said the portion received bids in excess of ₹7,000 crore against the offer of ₹5,630 crore for anchor investors out of a total offer size of ₹21,000 crore. Investors likely to have bid include Norges Bank and GIC among others.

84.title: 18-yr-old Harshada wins India's 1st ever gold at junior world weightlifting championships
84.article_body: Harshada Sharad Garud has become the first-ever Indian to win a gold medal at the junior world weightlifting championships. Competing in 45kg category, the 18-year-old lifted a total of 153kg, including 70kg in snatch and 83kg in clean and jerk. Turkey's Bektas Cansu bagged the silver medal, while Moldova's Teodora-Luminita Hincu won the bronze medal in the event.

85.title: 'Paper-thin' loudspeaker that turns any surface into audio source made by MIT
85.article_body: Researchers at the Massachusetts Institute of Technology (MIT) have developed a "paper-thin" loudspeaker that can turn any surface into an active audio source. The loudspeaker weighs about as much as a dime and produces sound with minimal distortion. As per the researchers, the loudspeaker could be used like wallpaper to cover walls, cars, or aircraft interiors or for immersive entertainment.

86.title: Trump asked 'Can't you just shoot them?' amid protests: Ex-US official in book
86.article_body: Amid widespread 'Black Lives Matter' protests in Washington, former US President Donald Trump had asked, "Can't you just shoot them?", former Secretary of Defense Mark Esper has claimed. "Just shoot them in the legs or something?" Trump had reportedly asked, as per Esper who has revealed details about the time in his memoir.

87.title: Cong's Punjab in-charge recommends disciplinary action against Sidhu
87.article_body: All India Congress Committee (AICC) in-charge of Punjab Harish Chaudhary, in a written letter to Congress President Sonia Gandhi, sought disciplinary action against former Punjab Congress chief Navjot Singh Sidhu. In his letter, Chaudhary wrote Sidhu continued to criticise Congress, even as the party was contesting elections, adding that Sidhu had a "hand in glove with Shrimoni Akali Dal."

88.title: Check loudspeaker usage at religious places: BJP MP to Delhi LG
88.article_body: BJP MP from West Delhi Parvesh Sahib Singh on Monday requested Delhi Lieutenant Governor Anil Baijal, Delhi Police and MCDs to ensure loudspeakers installed at religious places are either removed, or used at permissible levels. The Uttar Pradesh government has followed the Supreme Court order appropriately, Verma said, adding, "The same needs to be done by other states as well."

89.title: 3-storey building in Nigeria's Lagos collapses, 8 dead
89.article_body: At least eight people were killed after a three-storey residential building collapsed in Nigeria's Lagos on Sunday, an emergency management official said on Monday. "Twenty-three people have been rescued alive including seven children and 16 adults," the official added. Rescue operations are ongoing to look for more people who might still be trapped under the rubble, the official further said.

90.title: 19-yr-old Priya beats Olympian Dutee in 200m at Khelo India University Games
90.article_body: Priya Mohan, representing Jain University, defeated Olympian and two-time Asian Games silver medallist Dutee Chand to win a gold medal in the women's 200 metres event at Khelo India University Games 2021 in Bengaluru on Monday. The 19-year-old clocked 23.90 seconds, while Dutee finished the race in 24.02 seconds. Earlier on Sunday, Priya won a gold in 400 metres.

91.title: Govt warns Google Chrome users of high-level threat, asks users to update browser
91.article_body: The government's Indian Computer Emergency Response Team (CERT-In) highlighted multiple vulnerabilities in Google Chrome for Desktop in a 'high-severity' warning. Google Chrome's version prior to 101.0.4951.41 is affected. Vulnerabilities allow a remote attacker to execute arbitrary code, obtain sensitive information and bypass security restrictions. CERT-In requested users to update the browser.

92.title: Director Parthiban throws mic at audience, AR Rahman's reaction viral
92.article_body: A video of music composer AR Rahman's reaction to director Parthiban throwing a mic at the audience during a song launch event for 'Iravin Nizhal' has gone viral on social media. Parthiban lost his cool and threw the mic at the audience after Robo Shankar asked him to pass the mic. He later apologised and cited pressure as the reason.

93.title: Fabindia gets SEBI's approval for raising funds through IPO
93.article_body: Lifestyle retail brand Fabindia has received market regulator SEBI's approval to raise funds through its IPO. According to Fabindia's draft red herring prospectus, its IPO includes fresh issue of shares worth upto ₹500 crore and an offer for sale of over 2.5 crore shares. The firm's promoters also plan to gift over seven lakh shares to artisans and farmers.

94.title: Eid is even more special with success of 'KGF 2': Sanjay Dutt's wife
94.article_body: Sanjay Dutt's wife Maanayata said this year's Eid will be more special for them because of the success of 'KGF: Chapter 2'. "All the love and support Sanjay received for his performance in the film," she stated. "Despite all the challenges...he powered through for the love of his fans...the success of the film reinstilled that love even more," she added.

95.title: Hope to shift our embassy back to Kyiv by May-end: US amid invasion
95.article_body: US expects to shift its embassy back to Kyiv by May-end if conditions are feasible, its charge d'affaires said on Monday. US diplomats had departed from Kyiv embassy weeks before the Russian invasion of Ukraine began and had relocated some of its functions to Lviv, before shifting to Poland. Countries including UK and Hungary have reopened their embassies in Kyiv.

96.title: Hopeful to play vs Nadal on my 19th birthday at 2022 Madrid Open: Alcaraz
96.article_body: Talking about his potential match against Rafael Nadal on his 19th birthday at 2022 Madrid Open, world number nine Carlos Alcaraz said he's hopeful to play on Thursday provided he wins on Tuesday. "It's a special day...hopefully I'll be able to win this year," he added. Alcaraz had lost to the fellow Spaniard on his birthday in Madrid last year.

97.title: Would love to come to India to meet 1st Indian superhero: Benedict
97.article_body: 'Doctor Strange' actor Benedict Cumberbatch has said he would like to come back to India and meet the first Indian superhero. "I love India, I love your...cultures," he stated. Benedict had spent six months in India's Darjeeling to teach English at a Tibetan monastery. "I'd love...to come back...if that's to interact with the first Indian superhero," the British actor stated.

98.title: Choksi pledged fake gemstones to secure ₹25 cr loan from govt-run IFCI: CBI
98.article_body: Fugitive diamantaire Mehul Choksi used "low-quality, lab-prepared chemical vapour diamonds" and other 'fake gemstones' to secure a ₹25 crore corporate loan from government-run IFCI, CBI has alleged. After his company, Gitanjali Gems, defaulted on the loan, it was found that their actual valuation was 98% less than shown by the company. He's accused of cheating IFCI of ₹22 crore.

99.title: It can happen: Sehwag on CSK qualifying for IPL 2022 playoffs under Dhoni
99.article_body: Virender Sehwag has said CSK can reach the playoffs in IPL 2022 under MS Dhoni following his reappointment as skipper. CSK beat SRH by 13 runs to register their first win under Dhoni's captaincy on Sunday. Overall, it was their third win from nine matches. He added that Dhoni-led India have won many matches which they used to lose before.

100.title: Ukraine may lose millions of tonnes of grain due to blockade: Prez
100.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy on Monday said that Ukraine could lose tens of millions of tonnes of grain due to Russia's blockade of its Black Sea ports. "Russia wants to completely block our country's economy," he added. This could trigger a food crisis that will affect Europe, Asia and Africa, Zelenskyy claimed.

101.title: Political crisis in Maha, won't give them an inch of land: K'taka CM
101.article_body: Karnataka Chief Minister Basavaraj Bommai on Monday urged politicians of Maharashtra not to use border issues for their political survival, adding that the state will not give an inch of its land. "The politicians of Maharashtra raise the border and language issue whenever they face a political crisis in their state," he said.

102.title: India believes no one will win Russia-Ukraine war: PM Modi in Germany
102.article_body: India believes that no one will be victorious in the ongoing Russia-Ukraine war, PM Narendra Modi said in Germany on Monday. Peace talks are the only way to resolve the Ukraine crisis, he added. "Recent geopolitical incidents have shown that world peace and stability are in critical condition and showed how all countries are interconnected," said PM Modi.

103.title: Germany pledges €10 billion for bilateral cooperation with India
103.article_body: German Chancellor Olaf Scholz on Monday said Germany is pledging €10 billion (approximately ₹80,615 crore) for bilateral cooperation with India in the coming years. "When implementing the measures for these partnership projects, we will provide a great deal of funding over the next few years," Scholz said. This comes after PM Narendra Modi held talks with Scholz in Berlin today.

104.title: Taj Mahal entry to remain free for 2 hours for offering namaz on Eid
104.article_body: Entry to the Taj Mahal will remain free for two hours on the occasion of Eid-ul-Fitr for offering namaz at the mosque on its premises from 7 am to 9 am on Tuesday. Taj Mahal gates had remained closed for namaz on Eid in 2020 and 2021, because of restrictions and curbs imposed during the COVID-19 pandemic.

105.title: AAP expels leader for pro-Khalistan tweets, says it backs India's unity
105.article_body: AAP has expelled its Himachal Pradesh unit leader Harpreet Singh Bedi over his alleged pro-Khalistan tweets. The move came after BJP accused Bedi of supporting Khalistan cause, citing his past tweets which allegedly included demand for new currency for Khalistan. "AAP...believes in...unity & integrity of [India]...& [won't] tolerate anyone writing anything against our country," the party tweeted.

106.title: PIL seeks regulation of polygamy by Muslim men; HC asks Centre's view
106.article_body: Delhi HC on Monday asked the Centre to submit its stand on a Muslim woman's PIL seeking regulation of polygamy practiced by Muslim men. The PIL sought polygamy without the present wife's written consent be declared unconstitutional and illegal. It also sought adequate arrangements for the existing wife's accommodation and maintenance be made before allowing a man to practice polygamy.

107.title: Restaurant staff attack customers after complaint over food taste in Noida
107.article_body: Two people were hospitalised after being allegedly attacked by the staff of a restaurant in UP's Noida after they complained about the taste of cold coffee and shake that they ordered. The complainant Shailendra Pal said the restaurant's owner abused him and his two friends after their complaint. He allegedly called his staff who attacked Shailendra's friends with a knife.

108.title: Germany ready to back EU ban on Russian oil imports: Minister
108.article_body: Germany's ready to support a gradual EU-wide ban on Russian oil imports, Foreign Minister Annalena Baerbock has said. Baerbock's comment came after fellow minister Robert Habeck said that the country could be completely independent of Russian crude oil supply by end of summer. Notably, Germany has been top buyer of Russian energy since Ukraine's invasion began, a study recently claimed.

109.title: U'khand limits number of pilgrims for Char Dham Yatra starting May 3
109.article_body: The Uttarakhand government has capped the number of pilgrims during the Char Dham Yatra starting May 3 (Tuesday). Only 15,000 pilgrims will be allowed to visit the Badrinath Temple per day and the daily limit for the Kedarnath Temple is 12,000. It is 7,000 for Gangotri and 4,000 for Yamunotri shrine.

110.title: SpiceJet flight turbulence matter being dealt with deftness: Scindia
110.article_body: Union Aviation Minister Jyotiraditya Scindia on Monday said the turbulence encountered by SpiceJet's Mumbai-Durgapur flight is being dealt with "utmost seriousness and deftness". He said that the damage caused to the passengers is "unfortunate", adding that the Directorate General of Civil Aviation has deputed a team to investigate the incident.

111.title: New Zealand-founded IT company offers unlimited leave to employees
111.article_body: New Zealand-founded IT company Actionstep is offering its employees unlimited annual leave, The New Zealand Herald reported. "This way, it covers everything like sick leave, bereavement and maternity," Actionstep's VP of engineering, Stevie Mayhew, said. "We're a team, we trust each other and we believe our best work happens when life & work is in good balance," the company said.

112.title: India hits a century in style: Goyal as Open becomes India's 100th unicorn
112.article_body: Union Minister of Commerce & Industry Piyush Goyal tweeted, "India hits a century in style," after Bengaluru-based neo-banking platform Open became India's 100th unicorn. Open raised $50 million at a valuation of $1 billion in a Series D funding round led by IIFL, Moneycontrol reported. Six months ago, Open raised $100 million led by Google, Temasek, Visa, and SoftBank Investments.

113.title: Training, arming doesn't make Germany party to war in Ukraine: Govt
113.article_body: Germany will not become a party to the Russia-Ukraine conflict because it provides training to Ukrainian soldiers, German government spokesperson Steffen Hebestreit said. The possibility of Ukraine striking Russian territory with weapons it had received from NATO countries would not change this, he added. Last month, Germany had approved the delivery of anti-aircraft tanks to Ukraine.

114.title: Hopeful of things progressing in right direction at Madrid Open: Djokovic
114.article_body: Top seed Novak Djokovic said he's hopeful that things will progress in the right direction at Madrid Open 2022 after his runner-up finish at Serbia Open a few days ago. The world number one added that he has to be positive about his recent result. He further said he's yet to achieve his desired level of play.

115.title: Critic gave bad review to Sarfarosh due to issues with Aamir: Director
115.article_body: 'Sarfarosh' director John Matthew Matthan revealed that a critic gave a negative review to his film after watching it for just the first half because he had issues with Aamir Khan. "He was a total dictator. He saw only half of Sarfarosh. He walked out as he had issues with Aamir since [he] wouldn't attend his award functions," he added.

116.title: Shami told LSG pacer Mohsin that he's better than him: Coach Siddiqui
116.article_body: Revealing what Mohammad Shami told Mohsin Khan some time ago, the LSG pacer's coach Badruddin Siddiqui said, "Shami told him that Mohsin is a better bowler than him but just needed more focus." He added, "I called him during lockdown and said, 'learn whatever you can from Shami'." Playing in his debut IPL, Mohsin has taken eight wickets so far.

117.title: Spanish PM, Defence Minister's phones targeted with Pegasus spyware
117.article_body: The Pegasus spyware was detected on mobile phones of Spanish PM Pedro Sánchez and Defence Minister Margarita Robles Fernández, the Minister for the Presidency, Félix Bolaños García, said on Monday. Sánchez's mobile phone was breached twice in May 2021 and Fernández's device was targeted once the following month, he added. "We've no doubt...this is an...unauthorized intervention," he further said.

118.title: 2 SpiceJet flight passengers in ICU after being injured during turbulence
118.article_body: Two passengers of the SpiceJet Mumbai-Durgapur flight who were injured during severe turbulence on Sunday, have been admitted to ICU, DGCA said on Monday. A total of 14 people were injured when the flight got caught in turbulence during descent. The injuries occurred due to cabin luggage falling on them.

119.title: KKR to bowl first against RR, Venkatesh Iyer dropped
119.article_body: KKR captain Shreyas Iyer won the toss and elected to bowl first against RR in their IPL 2022 clash on Monday. Venkatesh Iyer has been dropped by KKR and he has been replaced by Anukul Roy. KKR have also included Shivam Mavi in their playing XI. Karun Nair has replaced Daryl Mitchell in RR's playing XI.

120.title: Salary was low but I survived: Naukri.com Founder on 1st job with ₹1,000 stipend
120.article_body: Naukri.com Founder Sanjeev Bikhchandani took to Twitter to share the offer letter he received for his first job at the advertisement company Lintas in 1984. He was offered the role of an Executive Trainee with a monthly stipend of ₹1,000. "The salary was low but I survived," Bikhchandani tweeted, adding that the "learning was great and the relationships were lifelong".

121.title: KKR's dressing room has opposite energy to GT, it's negative: Pietersen
121.article_body: Ex-England captain Kevin Pietersen has criticised Kolkata Knight Riders for their ongoing campaign in the IPL 2022. Taking to his blog, Pietersen wrote, "For a franchise as big as KKR, it's just a horrible state of affairs." "That is a dressing room full of the opposite energy to Gujarat: negative," he added. KKR have lost six out of nine matches.

122.title: Apple charged by EU antitrust regulators over mobile payments tech
122.article_body: European Commission on Monday charged Apple for restricting rivals' access to its Near-Field Communication (NFC) technology used for mobile payments. "The Commission's preliminary view is that [Apple]...restricts competition by reserving access to NFC technology to Apple Pay," the Commission said. EU regulators had last year accused Apple of distorting competition in the music streaming market.

123.title: PM Modi holds talks with German Chancellor on bilateral cooperation
123.article_body: PM Narendra Modi held talks with German Chancellor Bundeskanzler Olaf Scholz on bilateral cooperation in Berlin. The meeting was held prior to the sixth round of Biennial Inter Governmental Consultations between India and Germany. This is their first engagement since Chancellor Scholz assumed office in December 2021, the Ministry of External Affairs said.

124.title: No doubt they have to give Benzema the Ballon d'Or 2022: Perez
124.article_body: Real Madrid president Florentino Perez has opined that forward Karim Benzema should win the Ballon d'Or this year. "There is no doubt that they have to give him the Ballon d'Or this year, they can't take it away," Perez stated. Benzema is the top scorer in this year's La Liga with 26 goals and Champions League with 14 goals.

125.title: 5 injured as structure at construction site collapses in Pune
125.article_body: A structure erected for laying a slab at an under-construction building collapsed in Wanawadi area of Pune on Monday, injuring five workers who were trapped under it. Around 25 labourers were working to lay the slab on the first floor of the building. The fire brigade's teams reached the spot and rescued the workers.

126.title: Himachal will implement UCC soon, move won't harm Muslims: CM
126.article_body: Himachal Pradesh CM Jairam Thakur said on Monday that the state will implement Uniform Civil Code (UCC) soon, adding that the move won't harm the Muslim community. "I think everyone especially Muslim women will welcome this step...It will be beneficial for them," he added. Neighbouring Uttarakhand decided to set up a panel comprising of experts to draft UCC last month.

127.title: Imran Khan took away ₹6 cr BMW while leaving PM's office: Pak minister
127.article_body: Pakistan's Information Minister Marriyum Aurangzeb has claimed that former PM Imran Khan has retained an official vehicle worth PKR 150 million (around ₹6.17 crore). Khan allegedly took a BMWX5, belonging to the PM Office's fleet for foreign delegations, while leaving the top office. He insisted on keeping the car even after criticising previous governments for expensive cars, Aurangzeb said.

128.title: Delhi sees 6,194 MW peak power demand, highest-ever in May 1st week
128.article_body: Delhi's peak power demand on Monday clocked 6,194 MW at 3:34 pm, which is the highest ever peak demand recorded in the first week of May. Last month too, Delhi saw a peak of 6,197 MW, an all-time high for the month of April. India's energy demand reached an all-time high of 2,07,111 MW on Friday, the Power Ministry said.

129.title: Haryana changes school timings to 7am-12 noon amid scorching heat
129.article_body: The Haryana government has changed the timings of government and private schools from May 4 (Wednesday) due to scorching heat conditions in the state, as per an official order. The schools will now open from 7 am to 12 noon, it said. All district magistrates have been asked to ensure compliance of the government order.

130.title: Nearly half of Elon Musk's Twitter followers are fake: Report
130.article_body: Nearly 48% of Elon Musk's 87.9 million Twitter followers are fake, TIME Magazine reported citing Twitter auditing tool SparkToro's data. These accounts are "unreachable and will not see Musk's tweets, either because they're spam, bots, propaganda, or because they're no longer active on Twitter," SparkToro said. Last month, Musk struck a deal to buy Twitter for $44 billion.

131.title: UPI hits record high transactions worth ₹9.83 lakh crore in April
131.article_body: Unified Payments Interface (UPI) recorded 5.58 billion transactions in April 2022, a new all-time high for the payments platform since its launch in 2016, NPCI data revealed. In value terms, UPI saw transactions worth ₹9.83 lakh crore in April. This is a 3.3% jump in volume of transactions from March 2022 and a rise of 111% on a year-on-year basis.

132.title: Delhi replaces Dubai as world's 2nd busiest airport in March: Report
132.article_body: Delhi's Indira Gandhi International Airport was the world's second busiest airport in March in terms of domestic and international flights, travel data provider Official Airline Guide (OAG) said in a report. While Atlanta retained its first position, Dubai slipped to third. The report said Atlanta, Delhi and Dubai airports handled 4.42 million, 3.61 million and 3.55 million seats respectively.

133.title: Delhi records 1,076 new COVID-19 cases & no death, positivity rate at 6.4%
133.article_body: Delhi on Monday reported 1,076 new COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, as compared to 1,485 cases recorded on Sunday. The national capital also saw 1329 recoveries and zero deaths in the last 24 hours. The city's daily positivity rate was at 6.42% on Monday as compared to Sunday's 4.89%.

134.title: Karauli incident on Ram Navami was an experiment by BJP: Raj CM
134.article_body: Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot on Sunday said that violence cannot be the answer to violence and what happened in Karauli on Ram Navami was "an experiment by the BJP". "The RSS and BJP have decided to divide this country between Hindus and Muslims, between religions, castes. This is part of their agenda and this is just the beginning," he said.

135.title: T’gana ministers inaugurate electronics manufacturing unit in Hyd
135.article_body: Telangana IT Minister KT Rama Rao and Education Minister Sabitha Reddy inaugurated a manufacturing unit of Radiant Appliances & Electronics at Raviryala's e-city in Hyderabad on Monday. The plant, which has been set up with an investment of ₹100 crore, will generate additional employment for 1,000 people. "25% of India’s TVs will now be manufactured from Hyderabad," KTR tweeted.

136.title: BJP lists AAP's 'failures' in Delhi after 7 years of being in power
136.article_body: BJP on Sunday listed the alleged failures of the Aam Aadmi Party government in Delhi, which has been in power for the past seven years in the city. Delhi BJP chief Adesh Gupta said that CM Kejriwal opened only 200 mohalla clinics and Leader of Opposition Ramvir Singh Bidhuri said that 63% of people don't get DJB filtered drinking water.

137.title: Gadkari pitches for priority lending for alternative fuels sector
137.article_body: Union Minister Nitin Gadkari on Monday said firms involved in production or business of alternative fuels should be included in priority sector lending. "I shall speak about the issue with the Finance Minister and RBI Governor," Gadkari said. Priority sector lending will help such businesses to obtain loans from banks on easier terms, Gadkari added.

138.title: UP minister Girish Yadav hospitalised after suspected rat bite during tour
138.article_body: UP minister Girish Chandra Yadav was on Monday bitten by a rat or a mole rat during his visit to Banda, following which he felt uneasy and was taken to a hospital. He was fine and left for Lucknow later. A bite mark of a rat or mole rat was found on his right-hand finger, the Chief Medical Superintendent said.

139.title: Don't perform 'Maha Aarti' on May 3: Raj Thackeray to MNS workers
139.article_body: MNS chief Raj Thackeray on Monday appealed to his party workers to not perform 'Maha Aarti' on loudspeakers on May 3 so that no social tension is created during the Eid festival. "The loudspeaker issue is not a religious matter but a subject of public interest. What further needs to be done, I will inform tomorrow," Thackeray added.

140.title: BMC to work to boost Mumbai's last-mile connectivity: Maha Minister
140.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) will work to make at least one road in each of the 24 administrative wards pedestrian-friendly to boost the last-mile connectivity, according to Maharashtra Minister Aaditya Thackeray. This will be done under a pilot project, he said. Notably, the BMC maintains about 2,100 kilometres of roads in the administrative wards.

141.title: To aspire to be like IPL, is useless & has no logic: Salman Butt on PSL
141.article_body: Ex-Pakistan skipper Salman Butt, speaking about PSL, said, "To develop animosity with players or aspire to be like IPL, is useless and has no logic behind it." He added, "Both leagues take care of their players well enough...nobody has complained about the PSL." Butt stated that it is "pointless" to compare the financial side of any league with the IPL.

142.title: Winning game more important than 99 or 100: Gaikwad on getting out at 99
142.article_body: After falling one run short of a century against SRH in IPL 2022, CSK opener Ruturaj Gaikwad said he was a little sad. "But I was happy that I was able to gain momentum and take...pressure off Devon Conway. Whether it's 99 or 100, winning the game is important," he added. CSK beat SRH by 13 runs on Sunday.

143.title: Pic of Mithun in hospital surfaces, son says he was admitted due to kidney stones
143.article_body: A picture of veteran actor Mithun Chakraborty resting on a hospital bed surfaced online, with his fans expressing concern about him. His son Mimoh, however, revealed that the 71-year-old actor was hospitalised in Bengaluru due to kidney stones recently but has been discharged now. "He (Mithun) is fit and fine," said a report quoting Mimoh.

144.title: 176 dancers, singers perform non-stop for 12 hrs at an event in Pune
144.article_body: As many as 176 singers, musicians and dancers performed continuously for 12 hours at the 21st Brahmanad Sangeet Mahotsav in Pune's Dhayari. The event featured dance forms such as Bharatnatyam, Kathak and Odissi. In music, it featured Natya Sangeet, Tappa, Thumri, Tarana, Bada Khayal and Chota Khayal.

145.title: Govt lists 'danger signs' in people that require medical attention amid heatwave
145.article_body: The Ministry of Health in its advisory for citizens amid the heatwave listed 'danger signs' to observe in adults and children, that require immediate medical attention. Hot, red and dry skin and core body temperature ≥40°C are some of the 'danger signs' to be observed in adults. Among kids, indicators like decreased urine output and dry oral mucosa were listed.

146.title: Ukrainian drones destroy Russian patrol boats in Black Sea, video released
146.article_body: Authorities in Ukraine on Monday said its drones destroyed and sank two Russian patrol boats near the Black Sea's Snake Island. Sharing a video of the same, the Ukrainian Defence Ministry said that the vessels were Raptor boats. The footage shows an explosion resulting from the attack on one of the boats.

147.title: Ruturaj should be drafted into the Indian Test team: Vengsarkar
147.article_body: Former India cricketer Dilip Vengsarkar has said that CSK opening batter Ruturaj Gaikwad should be drafted into India's Test side. "Ruturaj handled Umran Malik upfront...The way Ruturaj played the speedster's fast deliveries, especially the short ones, should make the selectors happy," Vengsarkar said. "Indian players, of late, have found pace and bounce impossible to tackle," he said.

148.title: Drunk man rescued by police after he climbs tower in Hyderabad
148.article_body: Two police officials from Hyderabad's Tukaramgate police station rescued an inebriated man who climbed atop a tower for hoardings in the city. A video of the incident was shared by police online. According to police, the man, identified as Narsing Rao, had climbed the tower to die by suicide but was brought down in time and counselled by the officials.

149.title: Kohli, Ronaldo are two similar brands: Kevin Pietersen
149.article_body: Former England captain Kevin Pietersen has said that cricketer Virat Kohli and footballer Cristiano Ronaldo are "two similar brands". "What he (Kohli) needs to do is to have a look at...Ronaldo. Two similar brands in their different teams and in their sports. You have Kohli right at the top of cricket...Ronaldo is right at the top of football," Pietersen said.

150.title: Raj Thackeray's speech was divisive, police will decide action: Minister
150.article_body: Maharashtra Minister Dilip Walse Patil has said that MNS leader Raj Thackeray's recent speech in Aurangabad on loudspeaker controversy was divisive. "Police will listen to his speech...decide what's objectionable and...decision will be taken," he added. Thackeray has warned that if loudspeakers aren't removed from all mosques in state, Hanuman Chalisa will be played at a louder volume from May 4.

151.title: Very unfair: Nadal on Wimbledon banning Russian & Belarusian players
151.article_body: Former world number one tennis player Rafael Nadal has termed Wimbledon organisers' decision to ban Russian and Belarusian players from this year's tournament as "very unfair". "They (players) aren't to blame for what is happening with the war. I feel sorry for them...When the government puts measures in place, we have to follow them," Nadal said.

152.title: Karun Nair plays me best among all Indian batters: Trent Boult
152.article_body: Rajasthan Royals pacer Trent Boult has revealed that he thinks fellow RR colleague Karun Nair plays him the best among all Indian batters. "I haven't bowled Karun Nair in a game, but he has the ability to put any kind of ball I throw to him at the nets. So, at the moment, I would say Karun Nair," Boult said.

153.title: I was scared to death to be on 'Friends', Courteney helped a lot: Tom Selleck
153.article_body: Actor Tom Selleck said that he was scared to death to be on the show 'Friends'. "The hardest thing is to guest on a show...Courteney helped a lot...But that group's an incredible group of friends. They obviously became friends in life as well as on the show. And it shows. It was a wonderful place to work," he added.

154.title: I’ve seen Ratna Pathak perform in films, she's absolute magic: Ranveer
154.article_body: Ranveer Singh, who's working for the first time with actress Ratna Pathak Shah in 'Jayeshbhai Jordaar', said that he has only admiration for the veteran actor. "Ratna ma'am's kids used to be in my school. She used to always be around during dramatics and annual day," he added. "I've seen her perform on television, in films...She's absolute magic," Ranveer said.

155.title: Fire burns down L1 wine shop in Gurugram, no casualties reported
155.article_body: A fire burned down the L1 wine shop in Gurugram's Golf Course Road, according to reports. The shop caught fire around 12:10 pm and two fire tenders were rushed to the spot. The fire was doused in half an hour, officials said, adding that no casualties were reported. The fire could've been caused by a short circuit, an officer said.

156.title: Sri Lanka extends credit line with India by $200 million for fuel
156.article_body: Sri Lankan Power Minister Kanchana Wijesekera on Monday said Sri Lanka has extended a credit line with India by $200 million in order to procure emergency fuel stocks. Sri Lanka is in talks to extend the credit line by an additional $500 million, Wijesekera said at a press conference. Previously, India sent nearly 76,000 MT of fuel to Sri Lanka.

157.title: Wikimedia Foundation stops accepting crypto donations after eight years
157.article_body: The Wikimedia Foundation (WMF), which hosts Wikipedia, has announced that it will no longer accept donations in cryptocurrency. The WMF said it will also close its BitPay account, "which will remove our ability to directly accept cryptocurrency as a method of donating". The decision comes eight years after the organisation first began accepting donations in Bitcoin, Bitcoin Cash, and Ether.

158.title: I played Mohsin in the nets, then didn't want to face him: KL Rahul
158.article_body: LSG captain KL Rahul called their pacer Mohsin Khan "brilliant" as the 23-year-old picked four wickets against DC, helping them win by six runs. Rahul added, "I played Mohsin in the nets a month ago, [then] didn't want to face him...He was sharp, he's scary at times in the nets. It's not just the pace, he has a good brain."

159.title: Maha CM inaugurates replica of Shivaji Maharaj's fort in Mumbai
159.article_body: A replica of Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj's fort near Mumbai international airport was inaugurated by Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray on Sunday. A statue of Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj was also installed at replica fort. Notably, Thackeray didn't touch on political issues while speaking at the function and said that he would address them at a political rally on May 14 in Mumbai.

160.title: PMC to now offer staff free housing in gardens' residential areas
160.article_body: Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) has decided to provide free accommodation to Garden Department staff who want to stay in the residential areas in its gardens. The order, however, stated that the staff would have to pay for their water and electricity charges. The PMC had not been paying house rent allowance to employees staying in its gardens so far.

161.title: Idli seller held for possessing whale puke, worth ₹5 crore, in Mumbai
161.article_body: An Idli seller was arrested by Mumbai Police for allegedly possessing 2 kg of whale vomit worth ₹5 crore. The accused, identified as Shendu Raman Shrinivasan, had taken a loan for his idli shop and wanted to pay off his debts through the money from the sale of whale vomit, the officials of the Aarey Police Station said.

162.title: Salim was a good actor, skin phobia came in way of his success: Shyam Benegal
162.article_body: Filmmaker Shyam Benegal said that late actor Salim Ghouse was a good actor but "skin phobia" came in the way of his success in commercial Hindi cinema. "We suffer from a massive colour prejudice. We boast of plurality in skin pigmentation. But when it comes down to actual facts we suffer from a massive skin phobia," he added.

163.title: I was banned from the film industry after #MeToo movement: Kangana
163.article_body: Actress Kangana Ranaut recently revealed in 'Lock Upp' that she was banned in the film industry after she came out in support of the #MeToo movement. "The women who had come forward with accusations, they have all vanished from the face of the planet," she added. "I was banned from the industry, while the women I supported disappeared," Kangana said.

164.title: Alcaraz doesn't have to look at me anymore, he's a star already: Nadal
164.article_body: Rafael Nadal said tennis player Carlos Alcaraz is already a star. "He doesn't have to look at me anymore. He's a star already. He's doing amazing things," Nadal stated. Alcaraz recently won the Barcelona Open after beating Pablo Carreño Busta. "Happy about being a fan of tennis that we're going to have an amazing player for...a long time," Nadal added.

165.title: Ex-IAS officer Tarun Kapoor appointed Advisor to PM Narendra Modi
165.article_body: Former Petroleum Secretary Tarun Kapoor has been appointed as the Advisor to PM Narendra Modi, the government said on Monday. The 1987-batch retired IAS officer has been appointed for a period of two years from the joining date, the order said. Hari Ranjan Rao and Atish Chandra have been appointed as Additional Secretaries in the PM's office.

166.title: Dhoni had so much support towards the end of his career, they took him to WC: Yuvraj
166.article_body: Ex-India all-rounder Yuvraj Singh stated that several players including him, Harbhajan Singh, Gautam Gambhir and Virender Sehwag didn't get support from team management towards the end of their careers. He added, "Look at MS Dhoni. He had so much support from Virat Kohli and Ravi Shastri...They took him to World Cup. He went on to play 350 games."

167.title: 'Doctor Strange in the Multiverse...' earns ₹20 cr in pre-booking in India
167.article_body: Marvel Studios' 'Doctor Strange in the Multiverse of Madness', starring Benedict Cumberbatch and Elizabeth Olsen, has reportedly earned ₹20 crore in advance ticket bookings in India. As per reports, it has surpassed the advance booking numbers of 'Spider-Man: No Way Home'. Directed by Sam Raimi, 'Doctor Strange in the Multiverse of Madness' is set to release on May 6.

168.title: Hope my stardom & fan following will help me bag me some films: Karan
168.article_body: During a press conference, actor Karan Kundrra said that although he is dubbed as "the king of TRPs and star on television, he has a lot to achieve". "Even on the web show 'Lock Upp'...we had 5.2 million people watching live at 1 am," he said. "I hope my stardom and fan following help me bag some films," he added.

169.title: Kohli still comes to the gym with child-like enthusiasm: RCB fitness coach Basu
169.article_body: RCB's strength and conditioning coach Shanker Basu has revealed that Virat Kohli still comes to the gym "like a child". "The enthusiasm hasn't come down even one per cent. In fact, it has only gone up," he stated. "Virat is mainly...trying to build muscle mass. T20 also requires a lot of explosive energy; force production is a byproduct," added Basu.

170.title: If batters attack him, he'll attack them back: Ojha on RR's Chahal
170.article_body: Praising Yuzvendra Chahal, ex-India cricketer Pragyan Ojha said the more one challenges the RR leg-spinner, the better he comes out. "If batters attack him, he'll not go on the defensive, he'll attack them back," he added. In RR's last match against KKR, Chahal conceded 17 runs in his first over before claiming a hat-trick. He finished with figures of 5/40.

171.title: Kejriwal must visit RSS shakhas to learn about nationalism: BJP leader
171.article_body: BJP leader Parvesh Sahib Singh invited Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal to visit the RSS headquarters to "learn about nationalism". "Nationalism must be in our heart and mind. We know how nationalist he is. He raises questions about surgical strikes and opposes 'The Kashmir Files'. What about the riots that happened under his government in Delhi and Patiala," he said.

172.title: Odisha to build 1000 bridge-cum-dams to boost drinking water sources
172.article_body: The Odisha government to build 1000 more bridge-cum-weirs (low dams) across the state, senior officials said. These low dams, which will be constructed within three years, will function to boost the state's drinking water and irrigation sources, officials said. Notably, the state government have earlier built such structures and their impact was found positive, senior officials said.

173.title: SRH coach Steyn takes CSK captain Dhoni's autograph, pic goes viral
173.article_body: A picture of SunRisers Hyderabad (SRH) fast bowling coach Dale Steyn taking Chennai Super Kings (CSK) captain MS Dhoni's autograph after their IPL 2022 match on Sunday has gone viral. "GOAT recognises GOAT," a fan commented. "Steyn might be taking it for someone," another fan wrote. "Biggest legends in world cricket," another tweet read.

174.title: MyPillow's millionaire CEO rejoins Twitter, banned again after 3.5 hours
174.article_body: American firm MyPillow's multi-millionaire CEO Mike Lindell was banned from Twitter on Sunday, 3.5 hours after making a return to the platform. Lindell, a supporter of ex-US President Donald Trump, was banned from Twitter in January 2021 for spreading misinformation about the 2020 election. Twitter said Lindell's account was permanently suspended for violating the platform's rules on ban evasion.

175.title: Russian gas supply to Europe via Ukraine hits 5-month high
175.article_body: The Russian gas supply to Europe through Ukraine via the Slovakian border point of Velke Kapusany hit a five-month record high on Monday, according to Slovakian operator TSO Eustream.
