352.article_body: Veteran Bollywood actor Dharmendra has been admitted to a private hospital in Mumbai, reports said on Sunday. The 86-year-old was reportedly taken to the hospital four days ago and kept in the ICU, but has now been moved out of ICU and is being kept under observation. He will reportedly be discharged in a few days.

353.title: Benedict reacts to 'Doctor Strange 2' being banned in Saudi Arabia
353.article_body: Benedict Cumberbatch has reacted to Saudi Arabia's ban on his film 'Doctor Strange in the Multiverse of Madness' over an LGBTQ scene. "It's difficult not to become emotional about it, to be honest. But it is...an expected disappointment," he stated. The film was reportedly banned in the country over a 12-second scene where America Chavez talks about her "two mums".

354.title: Thank god you were born: Virat Kohli to Anushka Sharma on her b'day
354.article_body: India batter Virat Kohli, taking to Instagram, penned a note to wish his wife and actress Anushka Sharma on her 34th birthday. Sharing a picture with Anushka, Virat wrote, "Thank god you were born. I don't know what I would do without you. You're truly beautiful inside out." Reacting to this, Anushka commented, "Stole my words and my heart (CHEEESSSSYYYYY)."

355.title: Suman Bery takes charge as NITI Aayog Vice Chairperson
355.article_body: Economist Dr Suman K Bery on Sunday took charge as the Vice Chairperson of NITI Aayog, according to an official statement. "NITI Aayog's challenge is to...work with India's states, which is where economic development ultimately happens," the statement quoted Bery as saying. Bery has replaced Dr Rajiv Kumar, who had taken over as the Vice Chairperson in 2017.

356.title: Eid-ul-Fitr to be celebrated on May 3 as moon not sighted today
356.article_body: Eid-ul-Fitr will be celebrated on May 3 (Tuesday), the Markaz Chand Committee of Lucknow announced on Sunday. In an official statement, the committee said that the new crescent moon could not be sighted today. Eid-ul-Fitr, which is also known as Meethi Eid, is celebrated on the first day of Shawaal.

357.title: K'taka govt clears 60 projects worth ₹2,466 cr, to create 8,575 jobs
357.article_body: The Karnataka government approved 60 new industrial projects worth ₹2,465.94 crore, which will generate over 8,575 jobs, during the 131st State-level single-window clearance committee (SLSWCC) meeting on Saturday. As per the official statement, 10 large and medium-size projects worth over ₹50 crore each, 49 projects worth ₹15 crore to ₹50 crore each and one ₹5 crore-project were cleared.

358.title: Russian 'smart mines' deployed for the 1st time in Ukraine, can identify tanks
358.article_body: Russian troops in Ukraine have started deploying 'smart mines' that have reportedly never been seen on the battlefield before. The PTKM-1R can distinguish between tanks and non-military vehicles and can launch itself up to 100 feet in the air, reports said. The mines can scan the ground and rain explosives at their targets from above.

359.title: SRH's Umran Malik bowls the fastest delivery of IPL 2022
359.article_body: SunRisers Hyderabad (SRH) fast bowler Umran Malik on Sunday bowled the fastest delivery of IPL 2022, clocking 154 kmph against Chennai Super Kings (CSK) opener Ruturaj Gaikwad in his second over of the match. Umran overtook Gujarat Titans (GT) fast bowler Lockie Ferguson, who had clocked 153.9 kmph. Umran has bowled four of the five fastest deliveries in IPL 2022.

360.title: Thousands join anti-govt protests in Sri Lanka amid worsening crisis
360.article_body: Thousands of people in Sri Lanka joined protests against the government on Sunday amid a worsening economic crisis in the country. The protesters were led by the Sri Lankan opposition parties. "So many people are suffering from the cost of fuel and food. There are queues for everything," Sunil Shantha, a 58-year-old university lecturer, said.

361.title: World-beating retail revolution, bravo: Mahindra to Nilekani on e-comm project
361.article_body: Anand Mahindra praised Infosys Co-founder Nandan Nilekani for helping the government in building the open network for digital commerce (ONDC). "We're on the brink of a world-beating retail revolution," tweeted Mahindra. He added, "This will democratise e-commerce, liberating us from the dominance of a few giants & empowering millions of small shop owners...Bravo Nandan Nilekani."

362.title: India to build 1st indigenous hydrogen-fuelled electric vessel
362.article_body: The Ministry of Ports, Shipping and Waterways has decided to develop India's first indigenous hydrogen-fuelled electric vessel at Cochin Shipyard Ltd (CSL). The Ministry said the vessel will cost  ₹17.50 crore, of which 75% will be funded by the Central government. The hydrogen-based fuel cells are environment-friendly and already being used in bus, truck, and train applications, it added.

363.title: Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2 isn't psychological thriller like part one: Bazmee
363.article_body: Filmmaker Anees Bazmee has said that his upcoming film 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2' is not a psychological thriller like the Akshay Kumar-starrer and added that the sequel is a horror-comedy. "I was clear I didn't want to make a psychological thriller. If I had made it that way, there would have been direct comparisons," Bazmee stated. The film features Kartik Aaryan.

364.title: Tripathi has serious chance of getting a spot in India's T20I team: Steyn
364.article_body: SRH bowling coach Dale Steyn said middle-order batter Rahul Tripathi, who has scored 228 runs in IPL 2022 so far, has a "serious" chance of getting a place in India's T20I squad. "Given that the position he bats at [number three] is occupied by Virat Kohli in Indian team, it's going to be difficult to get that spot," he stated.

365.title: Russia should seize West's assets over 'theft' of Russian money: Lawmaker
365.article_body: Russia should confiscate property owned by Westerners in country in response to US' suggestion of transferring frozen assets of Russian oligarchs to help Ukraine, senior Russian lawmaker Vyacheslav Volodin said on Sunday. "The proceeds from...sale [of Western assets] should be used for the development of our country," Volodin said, adding that US, Lithuania engaged in "theft" of Russian assets.

366.title: 9 arrested over building collapse in China's Changsha city
366.article_body: The Chinese Police have arrested nine people, including the owner, following the collapse of a building in China's Changsha city, according to state media. These include three people in charge of design and construction and five others who gave a false safety assessment of a guest house in the building. About 20 people remain trapped in the rubble.

367.title: Centre will give additional power supply to UP: CM Adityanath
367.article_body: Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath on Sunday said the Centre will give additional power supply and the Indian Railways will provide extra rakes to transport coal in the state. "As of now, the power situation is normal in the state," Adityanath said and directed officials to ensure power supply according to the roster. "Don't make unnecessary power cuts," he added.

368.title: Govt issues public health advisory to states amid ongoing heatwave
368.article_body: Amid the ongoing heatwave, the Union Health Ministry has written to all states to disseminate the guideline document 'National Action Plan on Heat-Related Illnesses' to all districts for effective management. The Health Secretary said health facilities need to increase resilience to extreme heat by arranging uninterrupted electricity for constant functioning of cooling appliances.

369.title: LIC getting bids twice the size of its IPO anchor book: Report
369.article_body: Life Insurance Corporation's (LIC) IPO is getting bids twice the size of its anchor book, Bloomberg reported. LIC's anchor book, which contains a list of institutional investors for its IPO, will be announced on Monday. Singapore's GIC Private Limited and Norway's sovereign wealth fund are reportedly among the list of anchor investors for LIC's ₹20,557-crore IPO.

370.title: LSG batting order is fragile without KL Rahul: Jaffer
370.article_body: Wasim Jaffer has said LSG's batting line-up is "fragile" without skipper KL Rahul despite having good finishers in Ayush Badoni, Marcus Stoinis and Jason Holder. "If Rahul scores runs, they reach the score which they want, like 170-180 or more," he added. LSG posted 195/3 in 20 overs, with Rahul top-scoring(77) for the side against DC in IPL on Sunday.

371.title: Due to tukde-tukde gang's actions: Rijiju as UK MP criticises PM Boris for JCB pic
371.article_body: Law Minister Kiren Rijiju reacted to UK MP Nadia Whittome's criticism of UK PM Boris Johnson's picture on a JCB machine by saying, "I don't blame [her]." Rijiju said Whittome was "unaware of reality", adding, "It's the result of the negative campaigns launched by the Tukde-Tukde gang whose only aim is to discredit huge achievements of PM Narendra Modi's government."

372.title: There's no 4th wave of COVID-19 in India so far: ICMR
372.article_body: Recent COVID-19 data indicate localised spike in cases in some districts and not the onset of a fourth wave, ICMR's Additional DG Samiran Panda told TOI. "What we're seeing are blips and not the start of a new COVID-19 wave," he said. On the spike in COVID-19 positivity rates in some regions, he said it's mostly due to low testing.

373.title: LSG defeat DC to win 3rd match in a row, move to 2nd on the points table
373.article_body: LSG defeated DC by six runs to register their third victory in a row in IPL 2022. With the win, LSG have moved to the second position on the points table. LSG captain KL Rahul top-scored in the match with 77(51), while LSG pacer Mohsin Khan registered bowling figures of 4-0-16-4.

374.title: Zaheer was one of the most skillful bowlers I've ever faced: Smith
374.article_body: Praising Zaheer Khan, Graeme Smith said the ex-India pacer was one of the most skillful bowlers that he ever faced in his career. "He got the ball to swing away...had a great change of pace. He bowled well with the reverse-swinging ball," he added. Notably, Zaheer dismissed the ex-South Africa skipper on 14 occasions in 27 matches in international cricket.

375.title: Pics show huge traffic in U'khand as tourists rush to Dhanaulti
375.article_body: Amid rising temperatures in parts of the country, huge number of tourists were seen in Uttarakhand's Dhanaulti. Pictures show cars lined up bumper to bumper in the area. The hill states of Uttarakhand and Himachal Pradesh, which are close to Delhi, witness huge number of tourists every year.

376.title: Gupta brothers used ex-Prez Zuma against people of S Africa: Report
376.article_body: Indian-born brothers Atul and Rajesh Gupta had used ex-President Jacob Zuma against the people of South Africa, according to the latest report from Commission of Inquiry into Allegations of State Capture. Zuma had also installed lackeys of the Gupta brothers at key institutions, it said. Zuma "would do anything that the Guptas wanted him to do for them", it added.

377.title: CIA's first-ever CTO Nand Mulchandani studied at a Delhi school
377.article_body: Nand Mulchandani, appointed as the US Central Intelligence Agency's (CIA) first Chief Technology Officer (CTO), did his schooling at Delhi's Bluebells School International. He has a degree in Computer Science and Math from Cornell and a Master of Science in Management from Stanford Business School. The Indian-American also learned Public Administration at Harvard's Kennedy School of Government.

378.title: There's never a shortage of funding for good ideas: Shark Tank's Ghazal
378.article_body: Mamaearth Co-founder and Shark Tank India judge Ghazal Alagh said there's never a shortage of funding for good ideas. Speaking at a TiEcon event in Chandigarh, Alagh added, "I faced a lot of challenges when I first wanted to bring my idea into fruition. It is always better to take risks...than to bear the pain of regret later on."

379.title: Became suicidal in a relationship, tried to cut my hands: Payal
379.article_body: 'Lock Upp' contestant Payal Rohatgi has said that she was suicidal in a relationship in the past and revealed that she tried cutting her hands. "There was this love angle, which was very detrimental in my personal life. Got heavily into drinking...I used to be on prescribed drugs," she stated on the show. The actress is currently dating Sangram Singh.

380.title: BJP MP starts campaign seeking withdrawal of quota for tribal converts
380.article_body: Madhya Pradesh BJP MP GS Damor said tribals who convert to any other religion mustn't be given reservations mandated for Scheduled Tribes.  "We have been organising delisting rallies in all tribal-dominated districts," Damor said. Reacting to Damor's comments, state Youth Congress chief Vikrant Bhuria said Damor should be "ashamed as he himself is an MP from an ST reserved seat".

381.title: Fighter pilot wrongly identified as 'Ghost of Kyiv'; 'it's a legend', says Ukraine
381.article_body: The 29-year-old Ukrainian fighter pilot Stepan Tarabalka, who was recently killed in battle with Russians, isn't the 'Ghost of Kyiv' and didn't hit 40 planes as has been claimed, Ukraine Air Force Command said. "'Ghost of Kyiv' is a superhero legend whose character was created by Ukrainians!" it added. Tarabalka was killed in an air battle on March 13.

382.title: Greece lifts COVID-19 curbs for travellers ahead of tourism season
382.article_body: Greece on Sunday lifted restrictions for domestic and foreign flights, its civil aviation authority announced. The move, which is set to aid summer tourism in country, will now only require travellers to wear face masks, lifting need for them to produce vaccination certificate or a negative COVID-19 test. "All measures will be reviewed on September 1,” Greek Health Minister said.

383.title: SRH to bowl first against CSK as Dhoni returns as captain, CSK make 2 changes
383.article_body: SRH captain Kane Williamson won the toss and elected to bowl first against CSK in their IPL 2022 clash on Sunday. The match is MS Dhoni's first as captain in IPL 2022 after Ravindra Jadeja handed back captaincy to him. CSK have made two changes to their team, with Devon Conway and Simarjeet Singh replacing Shivam Dube and Dwayne Bravo.

384.title: Real Madrid's Ancelotti becomes 1st manager to win Europe's top 5 leagues
384.article_body: After Real Madrid won their 35th La Liga title, head coach Carlo Ancelotti has become the first manager to win league titles in all top five leagues of Europe. Ancelotti won the Serie A title with AC Milan. Ancelotti won the Premier League with Chelsea and Ligue 1 title with PSG. He also won the Bundesliga with Bayern Munich.

385.title: Ganguly, Dhoni used to think out-of-the-box, Pant is similar: Latif
385.article_body: Naming his choice for next India captain in limited-overs cricket, ex-Pakistan captain Rashid Latif said Rishabh Pant is a good option. "Players like Sourav Ganguly, Mohammad Azharuddin, MS Dhoni were different, they used to think out-of-the-box. Pant is similar in that way, he's unique," he added. Meanwhile, Pant-led DC have four wins from eight matches so far in IPL 2022.

386.title: Murdoch, Shankar's Bodhi Tree to invest $600 million in ALLEN Career Institute
386.article_body: Bodhi Tree, the investment firm backed by James Murdoch and former Disney executive Uday Shankar, is investing $600 million in ALLEN Career Institute. Bodhi Tree said that its investment in the 33-year-old test prep institute is strategic in nature. Founded by Rajesh Maheshwari in 1988, ALLEN operates 138 classroom centres in 46 cities across India and the Middle East.

387.title: BJP's purpose behind UCC is to target minorities: CPI(M) leader
387.article_body: Senior Communist Party of India (Marxist) leader Hannan Mollah on Sunday said that Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh and BJP's purpose behind bringing the Uniform Civil Code is to target the minorities of the country. His response came following Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma's comment stating, "No Muslim woman wants her husband to bring home three other wives. Ask any Muslim woman."

388.title: Why option of merging Pawan Hans with ONGC wasn't explored?: Cong
388.article_body: Congress on Sunday questioned disinvestment of the Centre's 51% stake in Pawan Hans Limited (PHL) and asked why the Centre didn't explore merging PHL with Oil and Natural Gas Corporation (ONGC). Congress spokesperson Gourav Vallabh said the Centre is "committing a series of blunders" and that the Pawan Hans employee union had also recommended merging PHL with ONGC.

389.title: Vietnam, Japan criticise use of force in Ukraine, call for war to end
389.article_body: Japanese PM Fumio Kishida and his Vietnamese counterpart Pham Minh Chinh on Sunday criticised the use of force in Ukraine and called for the war to end immediately. Kishida is currently on a visit to Vietnam. Separately, Kishida also criticised China's actions in South China Sea, where the Chinese government has constructed artificial islands and turned them into military outposts.

390.title: Southern Army Commander visits Pune's Armed Forces Medical College
390.article_body: General Officer Commanding-in-Chief Southern Command Lieutenant General JS Nain visited the Armed Forces Medical College (AFMC) and Military Intelligence Training School and Depot in Pune. At AFMC, he visited the skill laboratory which has mannequins, state-of-the-art equipment for medical training and simulators. He interacted with the faculty of the college.

391.title: Pics show Angelina posing with kids, visiting railway station in war-hit Ukraine
391.article_body: Hollywood actress Angelina Jolie visited the Ukrainian city of Lviv on Saturday amid the Russian invasion of Ukraine. The actress visited a Lviv cafe, Lviv's main railway station, and met people displaced by the war with Russia. The 46-year-old actress, a special envoy for the United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees, was heard saying, "I know how trauma affects children."

392.title: May you always shine like this: MI owner Nita Ambani to Kartikeya
392.article_body: Mumbai Indians owner Nita Ambani congratulated debutant Kumar Kartikeya after the team registered its first win in IPL 2022 after beating Rajasthan Royals by five wickets. In a video, Nita congratulated Kartikeya on a call. "You played really well...may you always shine like this," she said. Kartikeya conceded 19 runs in his four-over bowling spell and took Sanju Samson's wicket.

393.title: Need cow shelters at block level to protect them from heat: UP CM to officials
393.article_body: UP CM Yogi Adityanath on Sunday directed officials to set up shelters that can accommodate 2,000-2,500 cows at block level in bid to protect them from heat amid soaring temperatures. "There should be proper arrangements for green fodder, straw...in...shelters," CM Yogi said. UP government recently announced that it's mulling setting up "cow sanctuaries" for abandoned cattle in 30 districts.

394.title: Some after El Clasico celebrated as if they had won La Liga: Courtois
394.article_body: Real Madrid goalkeeper Thibaut Courtois, referring to Barcelona's 4-0 El Clasico win, said "some" players celebrated as if they had won La Liga. After Real Madrid won La Liga, Courtois said, "Some celebrated as if they had...won the title, that they had come back [to our level]." Barcelona defender Gerrard Pique had tweeted "We are back" after winning against Madrid.

395.title: Assamese Muslims don’t wish to be mixed with migrant Muslims: Assam CM
395.article_body: Assam Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma on Saturday said that Assam's indigenous Muslim population does not wish to "mix" with migrant Muslims living in the state. "It [state government] will take a decision in the future on who is a Muslim and who is a migrant Muslim. There is no opposition to this in Assam," CM Sarma said.

396.title: Man beaten to death over land dispute with nephew in Rajasthan
396.article_body: A man from Rajasthan's Jhunjhunu was allegedly beaten to death by his nephew and two others on April 28 over a land dispute, police said. The accused attacked the victim, Hem Singh, with rods and sprinkled chilli powder in his eyes. "They hit him on his...chest and head with rods which led to his bones being crushed," the FIR said.

397.title: Ayurveda startup by Gujarat student gets ₹2.5 crore funding at govt summit
397.article_body: Neelkanth Mardia, a final year student of Institute of Teaching and Research in Ayurveda, Gujarat, received ₹2.5 crore in funding from a private company at a summit organised by the Ayush Ministry. Mardia started Ayurveda-based cosmetic company Green Forest Wellness with ₹5 lakh in 2021. However, he wasn't able to expand it due to lack of funds, the Ministry said.

398.title: A confidence-building knock: Gavaskar on Kohli's half-century vs GT
398.article_body: Speaking about Virat Kohli's knock of 53-ball 58 against Gujarat Titans, ex-India batter Sunil Gavaskar has said that it was a knock that the former India captain needed. "It's a confidence-building innings. As far as the RCB is concerned, they will be...very happy," he added. In the ongoing IPL 2022, Kohli has scored 186 runs in 10 matches so far.

399.title: Won't participate in MNS' Hanuman Chalisa event in Maha: VHP
399.article_body: Vishva Hindu Parishad (VHP) National Spokesperson Vinod Bansal on Sunday said VHP and Bajrang Dal activists won't participate in the event being organised by Maharashtra Navnirman Sena (MNS) to play Hanuman Chalisa outside mosques on May 3. "[VHP] doesn't support any political party", Bansal said and added that VHP believes there shouldn't be a ban on recitation of Hanuman Chalisa.

400.title: Mumbai Police received 84 applications for use of loudspeakers
400.article_body: Mumbai Police Commissioner Sanjay Pandey on Saturday said that the police received 84 applications for the use of loudspeakers in the city. "Most of the applications are legal and have been approved by the police," he added. Notably, this comes amid the ongoing controversy over usage of loudspeakers at religious places.

401.title: 'Kashmir Files' depiction of KP exodus is false', says Wiki page; Director reacts
401.article_body: 'Kashmir Files' director Vivek Agnihotri shared a screenshot of the film's Wikipedia page which called the movie's 'genocidal' depiction of the Kashmir Pandit (KP) exodus "inaccurate and associated with conspiracy theories". Agnihotri said, "Dear Wikipedia, You forgot to add 'Islamophobia...propaganda...sanghi...bigot...etc'. You are failing your Secular credentials. Hurry, edit more."

402.title: Oh my god, 365 days ago I was in exam hall: US Open champion Raducanu
402.article_body: Reflecting on her past 12 months from being a school student to becoming a Grand Slam champion, world number 11 Emma Raducanu said, "Oh my god, like 365 days ago, I was literally sitting in an exam hall doing paper three." The 19-year-old became the first-ever qualifier to win a Grand Slam title at US Open in September last year.

403.title: India's pharma exports hit ₹1.83 lakh crore in FY22: Govt
403.article_body: Pharma exports touched ₹1,83,422 crore in 2021-22 against ₹90,415 crore in 2013-14, a 103% rise in eight years, the Commerce Ministry said. It added that currently, 60% of the world's vaccines and 20% of generic medicines come from India. The pharma exports in FY22 sustained a positive growth despite trade disruptions and drop in demand for coronavirus-related medicines, it stated.
